items.content_html:
Up until 1 to pick up oldest from a winter formal at school, awake until 2:30 waiting for him to get home from taking pics at an odr, then up at 6:30 when youngest decides to make French toast first thing.

I‚Äôm starting to see the appeal of kids eventually moving out on their own. üòÇ üò¥

items.content_html:
I slipped on the ice while taking Neville for a walk tonight. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll feel some random muscle pain in 2 days.

As much as 2C in January is nice, it‚Äôs awful for the sidewalks. I was ready to sell the house and move to Mexico.

I‚Äôd love to ditch Meta (FB, WhatsApp, IG, and now Threads), but whenever I open Threads I see posts from people i follow that I can‚Äôt find elsewhere.

Zuckerberg and Musk are vile, yes. But I want to connect with other humans‚Äînot brands‚Äîwho are on their platforms. ü§î

items.content_html:
TIkTok‚Äôs frantic effort to skirt the U.S. ban as the White House changed hands:

‚ÄúIt was all a game. It was like a competition: What‚Äôs a creative way to suck up to Trump?‚Äù the person said. ‚ÄúThey created a crisis and then averted it. But there was no crisis.‚Äù
items.content_text:
[TIkTok‚Äôs frantic effort to skirt the U.S. ban as the White House changed hands](https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2025/01/23/tiktok-ban-biden-trump-bytedance/): 

> ‚ÄúIt was all a game. It was like a competition: What‚Äôs a creative way to suck up to Trump?‚Äù the person said. ‚ÄúThey created a crisis and then averted it. But there was no crisis.‚Äù

items.content_html:
I see a resurgence in the use of Signal as a WhatsApp / Messenger / etc. alternative. Is it secure to share your username publicly? Or more of a thing you’d use to give directly to someone you know?

I wish I could get off Meta, but the WhatsApp moat is a huge one.

items.content_html:
I’m thankful that Ben Thompson woke up early to go deep on DeepSeek.

Meta, meanwhile, is the biggest winner of all. A big barrier to realizing their vision is the cost of inference, which means that dramatically cheaper inference makes that vision much more achievable.

Woof.
items.content_text:
I'm thankful that Ben Thompson woke up early to go [deep on DeepSeek](https://stratechery.com/2025/deepseek-faq/). 

> Meta, meanwhile, is the biggest winner of all. A big barrier to realizing their vision is the cost of inference, which means that dramatically cheaper inference makes that vision much more achievable.

Woof.

items.content_html: How to tell my movie selection is dominated by life with teens: the only movies I’ve seen out of all the feature films nominated at the 2025 Oscars are Inside Out 2 and Wicked.
items.content_text: How to tell my movie selection is dominated by life with teens: the only movies I've seen out of [all the feature films nominated at the 2025 Oscars](https://letterboxd.com/oscars/list/the-97th-academy-award-feature-film-nominees/) are Inside Out 2 and Wicked.
